alert.note: Alert for Clark (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 10:29AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Clark County through 1045 AM CDT... At 1029 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over West Union, or 12 miles south of Marshall, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Clark County, including the following locations... Darwin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
